1.text: When you sit down to dine with a ruler, consider carefully what is set before you,

2.text: and put a knife to your throat if you possess a great appetite.

3.text: Do not crave his delicacies, for that food is deceptive.

4.text: Do not wear yourself out to get rich; be wise enough to restrain yourself.

5.text: When you glance at wealth, it disappears, for it makes wings for itself and flies like an eagle to the sky.

6.text: Do not eat the bread of a stingy man, and do not crave his delicacies;

7.text: for he is keeping track, inwardly counting the cost. “Eat and drink,” he says to you, but his heart is not with you.

8.text: You will vomit up what little you have eaten and waste your pleasant words.

9.text: Do not speak to a fool, for he will despise the wisdom of your words.

10.text: Do not move an ancient boundary stone or encroach on the fields of the fatherless,

11.text: for their Redeemer is strong; He will take up their case against you.

12.text: Apply your heart to instruction and your ears to words of knowledge.

13.text: Do not withhold discipline from a child; although you strike him with a rod, he will not die.

14.text: Strike him with a rod, and you will deliver his soul from Sheol.

15.text: My son, if your heart is wise, my own heart will indeed rejoice.

16.text: My inmost being will rejoice when your lips speak what is right.

17.text: Do not let your heart envy sinners, but always continue in the fear of the LORD.

18.text: For surely there is a future, and your hope will not be cut off.

19.text: Listen, my son, and be wise, and guide your heart on the right course.

20.text: Do not join those who drink too much wine or gorge themselves on meat.

21.text: For the drunkard and the glutton will come to poverty, and drowsiness will clothe them in rags.

22.text: Listen to your father who gave you life, and do not despise your mother when she is old.

23.text: Invest in truth and never sell it—in wisdom and instruction and understanding.

24.text: The father of a righteous man will greatly rejoice, and he who fathers a wise son will delight in him.

25.text: May your father and mother be glad, and may she who gave you birth rejoice!

26.text: My son, give me your heart, and let your eyes delight in my ways.

27.text: For a prostitute is a deep pit, and an adulteress is a narrow well.

28.text: Like a robber she lies in wait and multiplies the faithless among men.

29.text: Who has woe? Who has sorrow? Who has contentions? Who has complaints? Who has needless wounds? Who has bloodshot eyes?

30.text: Those who linger over wine, who go to taste mixed drinks.

31.text: Do not gaze at wine while it is red, when it sparkles in the cup and goes down smoothly.

32.text: In the end it bites like a snake and stings like a viper.

33.text: Your eyes will see strange things, and your mind will utter perversities.

34.text: You will be like one sleeping on the high seas or lying on the top of a mast:

35.text: “They struck me, but I feel no pain! They beat me, but I did not know it! When can I wake up to search for another drink?”
